results.title: Driving home
results.brief_description:
A child is being driven through a real and imaginary landscape. We experience her subtle turmoil as she tries to make sense of these worlds.
This beautiful animation depicts the sense of disorientation and isolation felt by a young girl who is a recent immigrant of Australia. The quintessentially Australian backdrop of the wide open road serves to add to her mental and physical unease. The emotional confusion that is expressed in the narrative is realised perfectly in the shifting, sweeping motion of the oil paint animation. MIFF 2000

results.title: Drivers in Court
results.brief_description: Brian and Alex are both in court pleading guilty to similar speeding charges. Brian, unlike Alex, knows what to expect and what to say. The magistrate gives Brian a bond but Alex loses his licence.
results.description: Brian and Alex are both in court pleading guilty to similar speeding charges. Brian, unlike Alex, knows what to expect and what to say. The magistrate gives Brian a bond but Alex loses his licence.

results.title: Driven to kill
results.brief_description: A driving safety film profiling the character Hal Johnston, a safety conscious family man, an average American, a careful and considerate person - but a complete monster behind the wheel. Hal eventually befalls a bitter end and the narrative steers into sequences of more sorroful driving, a pretty girl with a big facial scar and a young couple with missing limbs. This film received an award from the National Committee on Films for Safety and was estimated that over 15 million people saw this film in the first year of its release. Prosaically narrated by Lowell Thomas.

results.title: Drip
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and Stuart Finley Productions
results.brief_description: Many thousands of gallons of water are unnecessarily wasted every day in America - and all over the world, especially in affluent countries. This film stresses the need for a community “Save Water” campaign.

results.title: Drinking: how will Charlie handle it?
results.brief_description: The film presents a variety of social and emotional factors which can influence an individual’s decision about drinking. Considers abstinence, drinking in moderation, and a number of consequences of excessive drinking. The film offers no conclusions but is designed to promote thought and discussion about the decision-making process regarding drinking.

results.title: Drills and drilling safety
results.brief_description: This video looks at the use of various types of drills, such as cordless and power drills, and also drill bits and accessories. It shows how to safely drill into metal, masonry and ceramics.

results.title: Drifting
results.brief_description: Looks at the British herring-fishing, ports drift-fishers in port, and leaving for the fishing grounds. Shows in detail the process of catching the herring.

results.title: Drifters
results.creator_credit: John Grierson and Empire Marketing Board
results.brief_description: The only film ever directed personally by John Grierson. A documentary made for the Empire Marketing Board about the men of the British herring fleets. ‘Drifters’ brought to the screen the labour of the North Sea herring fleet in such a way that the ordinary man or woman was made to realise, perhaps for the first time, that the herring on his plate was no mere accident, but the result of the labour and courage of other men.

results.title: Dressing up in the past
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Presents Lorri Baines, National Gallery Education Officer, demonstrating what the gallery offers children in terms of the history of clothing and costume. Using two children as models she shows how eighteen century aristocrats would have dressed and the restrictions imposed by their mode of dress.

results.title: Dressed for the part
results.creator_credit: Ronald Gardner and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: The increasingly important role of safety committees in watching for sources of danger to the worker and seeing that adequate protection is provided. Types of protective clothing for acid handling, welding, lathe work, drum handling and working at heights are shown in use. The film ends with a reminder that while safety committees are doing a good job, their work is ineffective unless the equipment they provide is used by those for whom it was designed.
